com.mcc.ul
Class AiDevice

java.lang.Object
  com.mcc.ul.AiDevice

public class AiDevice
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an analog input subsystem on a DAQ device. In addition to analog input methods, this class contains methods to access information and the configuration of the AI subsystem.

To create an instance of this class, call the getAiDev() method of the DaqDevice class.

Returns the value read from an A/D channel.

Parameters:
channel - A/D channel number.
mode - A/D channel mode.
range - A/D range. If the selected A/D board does not have a programmable gain feature, this argument is ignored.
unit - Unit of the A/D value.
Returns:

Throws:

aInScan

public double aInScan(int lowChan,
                      int highChan,
                      AiChanMode mode,
                      Range range,
                      int samplesPerChan,
                      double rate,
                      java.util.EnumSet<AiScanOption> options,
                      AiUnit unit,
                      double[][] data)
               throws ULException
Scans a range of A/D channels and stores the samples in an array in the background.

This method returns the actual scan rate, which could be different from the requested scan rate because of pacer limitations. When you call this method, control will return immediately to the next line in your program, and data collection from the A/D into the buffer will continue in the background.

Use getStatus to check on the status of the background operation. Alternatively, some DAQ devices support enableEvent for event notification of changes in status of background scans. Use stopBackground to stop the background process before it has completed. Use stopBackground after normal termination of all background methods in order to clear scan resources.

Parameters:
lowChan - First A/D channel in the scan.
highChan - Last A/D channel in the scan.
mode - A/D channel mode.
range - A/D range. If the selected A/D board does not have a programmable gain feature, this argument is ignored.
samplesPerChan - Number of A/D samples to collect for each channel in the scan.
rate - A/D sample rate in samples per second per channel.
options - A/D scan options.
unit - Unit of the A/D value.
data - Value of the A/D data.
Returns:
Actual sampling rate.
Throws:
ULException

aLoadQueue

public void aLoadQueue(AQueueElement[] queue)
                throws ULException
Loads the A/D board's channel-gain queue.

This method only works with A/D boards that have channel-gain queue hardware. Some DAQ devices do not support channel-gain queue, and some that do support it are limited on the order of elements, number of elements, and gain values that can be included.

Use getQueueTypes to determine the queue types that are supported by the AI subsystem. Use getMaxQueueLength to determine the maximum length of the queue for a given channel mode.

Parameters:
queue - Channel-gain queue array. Set to Null to disable the channel-gain queue.
Throws:
ULException

setTrigger

public void setTrigger(TriggerType triggerType,
                       int triggerChannel,
                       double lowThreshold,
                       double highThreshold,
                       ThresholdUnit unit,
                       long retriggerCount)
                throws ULException
Selects the trigger source and configures its parameters.

Parameters:
triggerType - Trigger type. When set to a digital trigger, all parameters except triggerChannel are ignored.
triggerChannel - Trigger channel.
lowThreshold - Low threshold of an analog trigger.
highThreshold - High threshold of an analog trigger.
unit - Unit of the threshold values.
retriggerCount - Number of samples to acquire during each trigger event when retrigger mode is enabled. This value is ignored when Retrigger is not specified when AInScan() is called.
Throws:
ULException

                 throws ULException
Returns the Status of the background operation currently running.

Returns:
The Status object.
Throws:
ULException

stopBackground

public void stopBackground()
                    throws ULException
Stops the background operation.

Execute this function after normal termination of all background functions to clear scan resources.

Throws:
ULException
